description: This club has everything for the trendy Queen's Street West lifestyle, including a wide variety of music, great food, pool and dancing.

reviews.title: don't bother
text: been going there for many years, but ownership changed and so did the menu. food was always amazing but not now. i am sorry to say i will never go back!!!

reviews.title: Not pretty but food pretty good
text: Stopped in for a cocktail and quick bite to eat. The decor is not much as it truly is a night band spot however our food was great! Homemade soup and fully loaded nachos with homemade chips. Very generous portions, good prices and very efficient wait staff. Check it out next time you are shopping Queen West

reviews.title: My favorite
text: Rivoli is my favorite spot in my favorite neighborhood. The staff always accommodates my allergies. Just ask them what they can do and what to substitute. I can eat appetizers at this place which is rare for me. The drinks are great and everything is reasonably priced. Go here!

reviews.title: Food reasonably priced
text: We listened to Beatles music throughout the meal! The soup was excellent and homemade.  I found my Malayan chicken  too spicy to eat but luckily the sauce and rice were separate.  Our vegetarian friend found an excellent meal to eat.  So this is quite a trendy place with slightly less trendy music. However we enjoyed the ambience.  Service was slick and efficient rather than friendly - but they were busy.

reviews.title: People watching
text: We had 2 four night stays in Toronto and called here for drinks on a couple of occasions. The staff were very friendly and chatty. Great for sitting and watching the world go by! Happy Hour between 3pm and 6pm made it even better üòÄ

reviews.title: Lunch in Toronto
text: While visiting Toronto with family we decided to have lunch at The Rivioli, it was a good decision, there was a good selection of beers and lagers and a decent food selection including vegetarian options. The food was cooked fresh and was tasty, the service was efficient and the guy very pleasant. All in all well worthwhile a visit for lunch or evening meal as there is a back room where live acts appear.

reviews.title: Non existent service
text: After reading the last review I‚Äôll be surprised after what just happened to me if this place exists much longer. Walked in ( 3 of us). No hostess and no one came. Saw an empty table in the bar area so we went in and sat. 10 minutes later no server, no acknowledgement, no nothing. Bartender and server walked right by us. We left.  Avoid this place. They don‚Äôt deserve your business.

reviews.title: Service makes the difference
text: We dropped by to grab a drink And snacks after a long day. The location is great and convenient but the food is basic nothing interesting so service is what takes a place like this over the top but they didn‚Äôt get that! The waitress had the worst attitude and doesn‚Äôt belong in the service industry. When I spoke to the manager she apologized that her server was having a bad day and justified her behaviour!?!?! She made no attempt to rectify the rude service but and as the saying goes, ‚Äúthe fish smells from the head‚Äù. This place could hv so much potential due to its location but it‚Äôs empty and I‚Äôm by there at least a few times a week. Will avoid at all cost. We work hard to earn our money, last thing we need is to spend it where the food is average and the service is way below! Also bathrooms are atrocious!  Hope you hv a better experience.

reviews.title: Cool Spot
text: My Fiance and I love to come to Rivoli whenever we Travel to Toronto. We'll spend a few hours playing pool and having some beers.  All reasonably priced.
The few meals we've had here were Great too.
Cool, casual atmosphere, intimate and fun. Plenty of pool tables available.

reviews.title: Noisy, bit hip, friendly
text: Noisy place, with limited menu. There is a gig place in the back. Bar on the left. A place for a quick bite. Grolsch on tap for the Dutch. Pad Thai was good, little bit too sweet. Beer tasted perfect and very friendly service. Perfect to crash down after shopping

reviews.title: very quiet during the day
text: Went for lunch to the upstairs pool hall because we had a coupon only valid there.  The food was mediocre but everything was under $11 so I guess that's expected.  Seems like it would be a good drinking place in the evening.  Free pool in the afternoons too.

reviews.title: Biggest Rip off lunch I have ever had!
text: I have been working downtown in Queen West for three years and have always passed by Rivoli but never went in until today.  Man, I wish I would have just kept walking.  They're menu is pretty slim, with few options, it's mostly a bar as their drink menu is much more extensive.  Our server was pleasant enough, and I have no complaints about his attitude.  However, he never informed me that the drinks were not refillable which I had assumed (at $3 for a simple iced tea, who wouldn't think that they were refillable).  Anyhow, as he was passing by our table, he asked me if I wanted another, of course I said yes, thinking that I wouldn't be charged another $3 (which I was).  Our food took a long time (we were late getting back to the office).  I had ordered sweet potato fries with my burger which were burnt, I didn't eat them.  When I told him, he asked if I wanted another order, I didn't because we needed to get back to work.  To my surprise, I was still charged extra for the fries and also charged for the little ramekin of dipping sauce that he asked me if I wanted with my fries (also not informing that there would be a charge for).  In the end, my bill was almost $21, basically for a mediocre burger and two iced teas!  I will never go back and will encourage others to do so as well.  There are far better places to eat on Queen Street.

reviews.title: Small portions but excellent food
text: The food is delightful and will leave room for dessert, which is equally delicious. Service can be a tad on the slow side if the place is busy but it's generally worth the wait.

reviews.title: Nice place
text: Food is ok and service good. They have a pool lounge ustairs. This is a quiet place for pool lovers.

reviews.title: New, but not better
text: The Rivoli has been around since at least the 1970s but has recently come under new management.  I saw a piece done on it on CBC News so thought we'd try it out.  We sat on the patio which is located right on busy Queen St.  It was great for people watching.  We had to wait a few minutes before the server came to ask us for drinks.  She needed to wipe down the table first and did so but without any comment.  She seemed a bit surly to start with, certainly wasn't friendly.  She gave us the menus and I was very surprised at how limited it was.  I had the pad thai because that was what was shown on the news and it looked good.  My partner had the salad with a side of grilled chicken.  I had a beer ($6.95) and he had a Martini ($ 10.95).  The Pad Thai was $ 11 and change (not bad) but the salad was $9.00 and the small piece of chicken was an added $ 5.00.  Perhaps it's just that we are not used to Queen St. prices, but it certainly seemed over priced for what we got.  The price for the two of us with our drinks and tip came to just over $ 50.00 and my partner was still hungry.  It certainly was not of the same caliber as the Rivoli that I remember from my U. of T. days.  Don't think we'll return any time soon.  Biggest disappointment was the menu with it's VERY limited choice.

reviews.title: So far... one of the worst dining experiences I had in Toronto
text: First of all, the service is incredibly slow even if the place was almost empty. Second the menu has very few and questionable options ..

Now, let's go to the quality of the food. The soup is comparable only to the one you can get with the cheapest flight company.... I was starving and I couldn't finish it.... (be careful, for one extra slice of bread they charge you extra!). The mac&Cheese are not better....it's just extra over cooked pasta (not even maccheroni) with greasy butter and water.... should I go on? There are so many good option close by, avoid this place!

reviews.title: Nice intimate concert venue
text: My girlfriend and I checked out the backroom concert venue at Rivoli for Delta Ray. It was our first time visiting and the security and ticket personnel were friendly and it went smoothly. The bar in the back is efficient and fast, the venue is small so you really get a good vibe from the place. Sound is decent!
Look forward to going back for the next show.

reviews.title: Friends getting together
text: So we had a get together with some friends here last week.  The service was actually pretty good.  We had ordered food and drinks.  Food was average for the area but above average for a pool hall/lounge.  The atmosphere seems a bit grungy but I like that so it was cool.  If you're looking for something a but more posh king street isn't too far away.  Overall I thought it was decent especially since I find most of the queen spots to be crap.

reviews.title: It was good!
text: My buddies and I had some drinks at the Horseshoe Tavern and was started to get hungry. We chose the first place we came across for dinner. The Rivoli was the winner.

With no expectations at all, we started our dining experience. Our waitress Alynne was great. She was professional and very efficient and attentive. The wine menu is very basic with the normal mark ups. The food menu was great. We order the spring rolls (crispy and tasty), guacamole (average) and wings (they were great - hot sauce had a good kick). I order the Lamb Roti. The portion size was on the large side. The taste was great and the lamb chucks were plentiful. It was served with a fresh green salad.
With food, wine, beer and after meal drinks, it came to just over $75 per person.
Would certainly recommend in you are in the Queen Street area.

reviews.title: Bathrooms are Filthy and the Service is Horrible
text: The bathrroms in this place are filthy and the staff is incredibly rude. While I was there  the staff kept interrupting my dinner conversation at my table and insisted we were talking about them. Very terrible dive, this place.

reviews.title: Pool and funky music
text: Our group traditionally closes a week of business by finding a pool hall. We had our usual pool party at Rivoli.  The pool tables were numerous and the atmosphere funky.  The music and acoustics in the place were reasonable and you could have conversation without shouting at each other. They had a reasonable selection of beers although their liquor selections were fine but not top shelf (no Patron or Belvedere).  The mixed drinks were rather pricey (over $10 for a margerita), but tasty.  Overall, a good time was had by all.

reviews.title: Great locale for pool and snacks
text: I met up with some friends for a birthday party on a Saturday night.  Lots of munchies and retro 80s tunes. Can't complain ... Was a perfect spot for what we did: very laid back and casual.

reviews.title: Nice Cozy Place for a drink
text: We stopped in here for a Burlesque show and spent an hour at the bar before the show. We ordered some food and it was pretty good. The bartender took good care of us and we had a good time.
